1.text: Select a knife that’s big enough to cut across the entire round cake.

2.text: Soak your knife in warm water before using it to cut your cake.

3.text: Use your knife to score a line through the middle of the cake.

4.text: Score a second line at a 70-degree angle to the first line.

5.text: Created a third line through the middle of the smaller triangle.

6.text: Score 2 more lines to divide the larger triangle into 3 pieces.

7.text: Use your knife to extend the 4 half-lines across the cake.

8.text: Cut your cake along each of the score lines to create 10 even pieces.

9.text: Warm your knife in water before you start to cut the cake.

10.text: Slice the round cake into long, thin strips.

11.text: Cut the long slice into 1 in (2.5 cm) strips.

12.text: Heat up your knife in warm water before you begin.

13.text: Cut a circle in your cake, 2 inches (5.1 cm) from the edge.

14.text: Cut the ring-shaped outer cake into 1.5 in (3.8 cm) wide pieces.

15.text: Slice the smaller round inner cake into triangles pieces.

16.text: Use this scientific method for cakes you plan to store.

17.text: Make one cut across the entire cake, slightly off-centre.

18.text: Cut the cake again, 1 in (2.5 cm) to the left of the first cut.

19.text: Use your knife to remove the thin slice from the cake.

20.text: Slide the 2 ends of the cake together and secure them.

21.text: Cut another slice from the middle, perpendicular to the first slice.

22.text: Repeat the process until the entire cake is eaten.
